column4: can someone provide me guidance on how to set up a Git server on my ubuntu server machine?
youre installing ubuntu or you're trying to set up git on ubuntu?
I want to setup a Git repository so i can push projects up and pull them down remotely from anywhere instead of having to keep a lcoal copy
git init --bare, then try to pull from it like $> git pull user@mycomp:/path/to/repo
you don't really have to set up a 'server' per se
unless it's important to you that you pull from a git:// URL
does that help you? I assumed you already had SSH running but I forgot to make sure
just remember to use --bare when you want other people to pull/push to it
hey, im getting this: "fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git" when i try to set things up
you'll probably need to pastebin the actual git commands you used to create the repository and what you used to clone

i setup a new user called "git" and i created a new folder called "repo.git" and inside that folder i did a "git --bare init". This was done via SSH to my server. then on my local machine, i did "git remote add origin git@homeserver:repo.git"
you want to do "git clone git@myserver:repo.git" first before you do any "git remote ..."
alternatively you can do "mkdir repo; cd repo; git init; git pull git@..."
